qas.question: What are older migrating birds better at?
How was the migrating of ospretys and honey buzzards tracked?
What do the birds do to successfully perform long distance migration?

answers.text: recognize habitats and form mental maps

qas.question: What are examples of day migrating raptors?

context: The ability of birds to navigate during migrations cannot be fully explained by endogenous programming, even with the help of responses to environmental cues. The ability to successfully perform long-distance migrations can probably only be fully explained with an accounting for the cognitive ability of the birds to <a2_0>recognize habitats and form mental maps<a2_0/>. <a1_0>Satellite<a1_0/> tracking of day migrating raptors such as <a3_0>ospreys and honey buzzards<a3_0/> has shown that older individuals are better at <a0_0>making corrections for wind drift<a0_0/>.
